events.text:
Made by Viridino Studios (@ViridinoStudios)

Mateus Ferreira - Programmer

children.text: Reset global variables to prevent traces from previous sessions.
Setup the player by adding its graphics to the collider as a child.
Receive and store input from the player to be used later in many situations.
Toggle input left.
Toggle input right.
Toggle input up.
Toggle input down.
Calculate both axis and looking angle based on the player input.
Move the player horizontally based on its horizontal axis.
Simulate player jump.
Mirro the player graphics based on its horizontal axis.
Only allow the rest of the animations to played if the player is not already casting an orb.
Change the animation states depending on what the player is currently doing.
Walk animation.
Idle animation.
Jump animation.
Fall animation.
Spawn different types of dust particles depending on the player actions.
Walking dust.
Landing dust.
Jumping dust.
Setup the trigger position to match to platform top mechanism.
Destroy the player object and create a giant white flash.

actions.text: Shake the screen for a moment.

children.text: Setup the giant white flash and animate it to disappear after some time.
Cast an orb from the player's hand.
Only allows the player to shoot a new orb if it's not already doing so.

actions.text: Shake the screen for a moment.

children.text: Recharge the power after the casting animation is done.
Destroy the bullet whenever it hits a wall.
Spawn explosion particles when the bullet is destroyed.

actions.text: Shake the screen for a moment.

children.text: Destroy the particles after their animation is done to prevent CPU overload.
Create a trail effect behind the bullet.

actions.text: Adjust the trail angle to point towards the bullet.
Adjust the trail width to reach the bullet last position.

children.text: Spawn and setup shock effects.
Update de bullet last position.
Move the fire light up so the lava doesn't cove it too much.
Check if there's enough room below the lava collider to create some sort of "extension" at the bottom.
Use a ray cast to measure the distance between the collider and the ground.
Destroy the orb and set it's position to one of the lava collider to force the engine to choosing only one instance.
Spawn a lava pillar while making the screen shake for a moment.
Destroy the lava particles after its timer is done, which is synced with the pillar animation.
Spawn lava bubble on the surface of a random lava collider.

actions.text: Update the lava river offset in order to give it a feeling of slow but constant motion.
Set the lava bubble position to match the lava river height.

children.text: How fast the camera will track the player.
How far from the player the camera will be.
Interpolate the camera position to constantly track the player with smooth movement. Also apply a pre defined offset value each axis.

parameters.x: lerp(Self.X, PlayerCollision.X + CAMERAXOFFSET, CameraSpeed * TARGETFRAMERATE * dt)
parameters.y: lerp(Self.Y, PlayerCollision.Y + CAMERAYOFFSET, CameraSpeed * TARGETFRAMERATE * dt)

children.text: Create a screen shake effect to add more intensity to specific actions.
If the player collides with the lava, restart the game.
Update the pixellate effect to match the current pixel density of the window.
Restart the game.
Close the game.
Constantly adjust the Z order of all objects to make sure they're being properly displayed.
